Rule.Name: sWordPR
Rule.Title: The build number for winword.exe indicates a Private Release (PR) build and this is an unsupported configuration
Rule.Text: The build number for winword.exe '{0}' indicates a Private Release (PR) build. PR builds are intended only for testing and not production use. Please click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the latest publicly available update for Microsoft Word listed in the article.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMWord2007
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=12 and not($SKU2007='0011' or $SKU2007='001B' or $SKU2007='002E' or $SKU2007='0030') and not($SKU2007='')
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMWord2010
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Object.Key4: Name LIKE '%Office 14, Office%' AND ProductKeyID LIKE '%%PID%%'

Rule.Name: sNoIRMWord201064
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Object.Key4: Name LIKE '%Office 14, Office%' AND ProductKeyID LIKE '%%PID%%'

Rule.Name: sNoIRMWord2013
Rule.Query: contains('%PRODUCTCODE%','0FF1CE') and $n2DigitVersion=15 and not(($SKU2013='0011' and ($ReleaseType2013='1' or $ReleaseType2013='0')) or $SKU2013='001B')
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMWord201364
Rule.Query: contains('%PRODUCTCODE%','0FF1CE') and $n2DigitVersion=15 and not(($SKU201364='0011' and ($ReleaseType201364='1' or $ReleaseType201364='0')) or $SKU201364='001B')
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Rule.Name: sNoIRMC2RWord2013
Rule.Title: {0} doesn't support Information Rights Management
Rule.Text: You have {0} installed. It does not support the Information Rights Management feature.

Object.Name: Office 2013 Modern Authentication support for Office 365

Rule.Name: fKB2956163Installed
Rule.Text: {1} (or later) is{0}installed

Rule.Name: sAdalEnabled
Rule.Title: All prerequisites for ADAL are{0}installed

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerWord14
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: You have a version ({0}) of the PDFMaker add-in installed that is not compatible with Word. Please update the add-in to version 10 or higher. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerWord14x64
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=14 and $bitness='x64' and versioncompare($.,'10.1.0.0')<0 and ($hkcuPDFMaker or $hklmPDFMaker or $hklmWowPDFMaker)
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: The Adobe PDFMaker add-in was found on a computer that also has a 64-bit install of Office. The PDFMaker add-in version you have ({0}) is not supported with 64-bit versions of Office. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerWord15
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: You have a version ({0}) of the PDFMaker add-in installed that is not compatible with Word. Please update the add-in to version 11.0.1 or higher. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sPowerWordAddinFoundWD13
Rule.Title: PowerWord add-in is installed and has been known to crash Word 2013
Rule.Text: You have the PowerWord add-in installed and it has been found to crash Word 2013 on some computers.

Rule.Name: sAddInLoadTimeDisplayHKCU
Rule.Text: Load time = {0}

Rule.Name: sAddInLoadTimeDisplayHKLM
Rule.Text: Load time = {0}

Rule.Name: sAddInLoadTimeDisplayWow
Rule.Text: Load time = {0}

Rule.Name: sDisabledAddins
Rule.Title: Add-ins have been automatically disabled because of performance or stability issues
Rule.Text: Word add-ins have been disabled due to performance or stability issues. To see the list of disabled add-ins, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'Disabled Add-ins' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sUserReenabledAddins
Rule.Title: Problematic add-in(s) re-enabled by the user
Rule.Text: {0} add-in(s) disabled by Word because of performance or stability issues was/were re-enabled by the user. To see the list of disabled add-ins that were re-enabled by the user, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'DoNotDisableAddinList' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sFineReader9DetectedWD
Rule.Title: FineReader 9.0 add-in detected in the registry
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Word to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Word.

Rule.Name: sFineReader10DetectedWD
Rule.Title: FineReader 10.0 add-in detected in the registry
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Word to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Word.

Rule.Name: sFineReader11DetectedWD
Rule.Title: FineReader 11.0 add-in detected in the registry
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Word to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Word.

Rule.Name: sFineReader9DetectedWDWow
Rule.Title: FineReader 9.0 add-in detected under the \Wow6432Node registry key
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Word to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Word.

Rule.Name: sFineReader10DetectedWDWow
Rule.Title: FineReader 10.0 add-in detected under the \Wow6432Node registry key
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Word to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Word.

Rule.Name: sFineReader11DetectedWDWow
Rule.Title: FineReader 11.0 add-in detected under the \Wow6432Node registry key
Rule.Text: The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Word to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Word.

Rule.Name: sLatinFontSettingBlankWD
Rule.Title: Text in email messages may display as unreadable characters
Rule.Text: The text in email messages you receive may contain characters that are unreadable. This problem occurs when the 'Latin' string value under {0} is blank. Click the 'Click here ...' link for details.

Rule.Name: sDisableRobustifiedUNC
Rule.Title: DisableRobustifiedUNC=1
Rule.Text: This registry value is only intended for troubleshooting purpose and is not supported in production environment.

Rule.Name: sOfficeFileValidation
Rule.Text: The Office File Validation (OFV) is installed on the computer and configured to load
Rule.Title: The Office File Validation (OFV) is installed on the computer. Because the add-in is configured to process files when they are opened, these files may open more slowly than when the OFV add-in is not installed.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOff
Rule.Title: VBA functionality is impaired or disabled (HKCU registry data)
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value in the HKCU registry hive is set to a value other than 0. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOff
Rule.Title: Visual Basic for Applications is disabled (HKLM registry data)
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value = 1 in the registry under the HKLM hive. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sTermServSpellStartTooHigh
Rule.Title: Possible performance issues due to TerminalServerSpellingStart policy
Rule.Text: Outlook may experience peformance problems or cause high CPU because the TerminalServerSpellingStart policy value for Word is set too high. The default value is 5000 (decimal). Please consider lowering the value specified for the policy.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA Functionality is impaired or disabled due to Policy under HKCU
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKCU. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sWordOptionsAssistFound
Rule.Title: Outlook preview of Word documents is impaired due to Policy under HKCU
Rule.Text: The registry contains the following subkey: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\15.0\Word\Options\Assist. When the registry contains this subkey, Outlook cannot preview a Word document. Click the 'Click here ...' link for details.

Rule.Name: sKB2899568FreezeAssistMsi
Rule.Title: Registry data found under \Assist that may cause Word to stop responding
Rule.Text:
You have one or more values under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\15.0\Word\Options\Assist and your Microsoft Word version is {1}. In this configuration, Word has been known to stop responding.
To resolve this problem, click the 'Click here ...' link and install the {0} update from the article. Or, install the latest Word 2013 update from Microsoft Update.

Rule.Name: sKB2899568FreezeAssistC2R
Rule.Title: Registry data found under \Assist that may cause Word to stop responding
Rule.Text:
You have one or more values under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\15.0\Word\Options\Assist and your Microsoft Word version is {1}. In this configuration, Word has been known to stop responding.
To resolve this problem, click the 'Click here...' link and then follow the instructions provided in the article to update your Office installation.

Rule.Name: sKB2899568FreezeVprsuMsi
Rule.Title: Registry data found under \VPRSU that may cause Word to stop responding
Rule.Text:
You have one or more values under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\15.0\Word\Options\VPRSU and your Microsoft Word version is {1}. In this configuration, Word has been known to stop responding.
To resolve this problem, click the 'Click here ...' link and install the {0} update from the article. Or, install the latest Word 2013 update from Microsoft Update.

Rule.Name: sKB2899568FreezeVprsuC2R
Rule.Title: Registry data found under \VPRSU that may cause Word to stop responding
Rule.Text:
You have one or more values under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\15.0\Word\Options\VPRSU and your Microsoft Word version is {1}. In this configuration, Word has been known to stop responding.
To resolve this problem, click the 'Click here...' link and then follow the instructions provided in the article to update your Office installation.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA Functionality is impaired or disabled due to Policy under HKLM
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKLM. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Last Word crashes
Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Last Word crashes

Rule.Name: sOfficeQFE34188
Rule.Title: Word 2010 is randomly crashing in module MSVCR90.dll
Rule.Text: Due to a confirmed bug in Word 2010, the application is randomly crashing in module MSVCR90.dll. This problem is fixed by installing the December 2012 cumulative update for Word 2010, or a later cumulative update.

Rule.Name: bucketLookup
Rule.Title: Event 1001

Rule.Name: sUnattendedAutomation
Rule.Title: Word is detected to be working in non-user interactive mode through DCOM Settings
Rule.Text: Microsoft does not recommend, nor support, automation of Office applications from any unattended, non-interactive client application or component (including ASP, ASP.NET, DCOM, and NT Services).Please remove the DCOM settings for the Word.

Rule.Name: sWDAccessDBEngineX64PlusOfficeX86
Rule.Title: Unsupported configuration found: The 64-bit Microsoft Access database engine 2010 is installed along with a 32-bit version of Office 2010
Rule.Text: You have the 64-bit Microsoft Access database engine 2010 installed but you have a 32-bit version of Office 2010 installed. Mixing the 'bitness' of two Office products is not supported and can cause errors opening Word files.
Rule.Symptoms: Configuration (unsupported or problematic),File Open error,Error message
